CONJUGATES: lectures (noun plural) | lectures (verb 3rd person singular present) | lecturing (verb present participle) | lectured (verb past tense, past participle)
ETYMOLOGY: From Middle French lecture 'reading, lesson', from Medieval Latin lectura 'a reading', from Latin lectus, past participle of legere 'to read, gather, collect'. The sense of 'a discourse given to an audience for instruction' developed in the 16th century.
SINCE: Early 14th century (as 'reading aloud'); 16th century (as 'discourse for instruction')

MEANINGS.PATTERN:
a lecture on [sth]
attend a lecture
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A formal talk given to a group of people, especially students in a university, to teach them about a particular subject.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 讲座；演讲；（大学里的）授课，课
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Professor Davies gave a fascinating lecture on medieval history.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 戴维斯教授做了一个关于中世纪历史的精彩讲座。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A long, serious talk given to someone to criticize their behavior or tell them what they should or should not do.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: My father gave me a lecture about being more responsible.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我父亲就我应该更负责任地生活教训了我一顿。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word or phrase that describes an action, condition, or experience.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To give a formal talk to a group of people on a particular subject, especially as a method of teaching in a university.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （尤指在大学里）讲授，讲课；作报告
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She lectures on linguistics at the local university.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她在当地大学讲授语言学。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word or phrase that describes an action, condition, or experience.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To talk to someone in an angry or serious way because you think they have done something wrong.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Don't lecture me about my choices; it's my life!
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 别教训我我的选择；这是我的人生！

REGISTER: Generally formal when referring to academic talks, but can be informal when referring to a scolding.
